ETYMOLOGY: From Old English dēor 'wild animal, beast' (originally any animal, not just the Cervidae family), from Proto-Germanic *deuzam.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A hoofed ruminant mammal of the family Cervidae, the males of which typically have antlers that are shed annually.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 鹿科动物，雄性通常长有鹿角并每年脱落。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: A majestic stag, a male deer, stood proudly at the edge of the forest.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 一头雄伟的雄鹿骄傲地站在森林边缘。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: In ancient times, hunters would pursue any wild deer in the woods.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在古代，猎人会在森林里追逐任何野生动物。
